metadata.title: CVE-2015-3281 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The buffer_slow_realign function in HAProxy 1.5.x before 1.5.14 and 1.6-devdoes not properly realign a buffer that is used for pending outgoing data,which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information(uninitialized memory contents of previous requests) via a crafted request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3281` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

haproxy - 1.4.24-2
vim-haproxy - 1.4.24-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: haproxy package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.24-2').
